Description:
Patient Care and Consultation: Conduct thorough medical assessments, diagnose illnesses, and create treatment plans for patients. Provide consultations for general health concerns, chronic conditions, and minor injuries.
Prescription and Medication Management: Prescribe medications and treatments,monitor their effectiveness, and make necessary adjustments based on patient responses.
Health Promotion and Preventive Care: Educate patients about preventive health measures, lifestyle changes, and vaccination schedules to improve overall well-being and reduce the risk of diseases.
Medical Procedures: Perform minor medical procedures such as wound suturing, minor surgical procedures, and basic medical interventions.
Medical Record Keeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical records for each patient, including medical history, examination findings, diagnoses, and treatment plans.
Referrals: Evaluate the need for specialist care and make appropriate referrals to medical specialists or other healthcare providers when necessary.
Emergency Care: Provide initial emergency medical care to stabilize patients before they are transferred to the appropriate department for further treatment.
Continuing Education: Stay updated with the latest medical research, treatment guidelines, and healthcare trends to ensure the delivery of evidence-based medical care.Skills
Skills:
Medical Expertise: Strong knowledge of medical conditions, diagnoses, treatments, and medications. Ability to apply evidence-based medicine in clinical practice.
Diagnosis and Assessment: Proficient in conducting thorough medical assessments, performing physical examinations, and interpreting diagnostic tests.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to explain medical information clearly to patients, families, and colleagues.
Empathy and Bedside Manner: Compassion and the ability to build strong patient-doctor relationships by showing empathy, active listening, and understanding.
Clinical Decision-Making: Skill in making sound medical judgments, considering various factors such as patient history, examination findings, and diagnostic results.
Emergency Response: Ability to manage medical emergencies, provide initial stabilization, and coordinate with emergency teams when needed.
